section.condition: TITLE=Trade Services: Import Letter Of Credit;PERM=lc_access
section.para: A Letter of Credit (LC) or Documentary Credit is a banking mechanism that enables importers to offer secure terms to exporters. It is an undertaking given by a bank (the Issuing Bank) on behalf of the buyer (applicant) to pay a seller (beneficiary) a given amount of money on presentation of specified documents guaranteeing the supply of goods within specific time limits. These documents, conforming to terms and conditions set out in the letter of credit, are to be presented at a specified place.

The module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the importer and applicant), to initiate Letter of Credit requests, submit them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them and exchange messages about them with this bank.
The chapter for each individual module gives details and differences specific to the module.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "LC", "Letter Of Credit", "Import LC", and "Import Letter of Credit" are used interchangeably.
The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Import Letter of Credit Functions
section.para: The menu for this Module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: Enter the desired terms of a new Letter of Credit and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.
Amend the terms of an existing Letter of Credit and submit it to the Issuing Bank for its perusal.
Send a free-format message to the Issuing Bank. A typical use of this feature could be to state your acceptance of a presentation of documents despite reported discrepancies.
View all existing Import Letters of Credit, that are not yet complete..
Display lists of existing Import Letters of Credit, according to specific search criteria
Maintain Unsigned, Purged and Rejected LCs.

section.title: LC Initiation
section.para: This section describes the LC Initiation part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: LC Initiation Options
section.para:
This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to request an Import Letter of Credit, or to create a template to be used in creating requests for Letters of Credit.
From Scratch
Enter the desired terms of a new Letter of Credit and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.
Free Format
Create a free-format Import Letter of Credit and attach a file containing the details.
From Template
Upon using the option from template, all values from the referred template shall be populated with exception to dates, currency, amount ,customer reference,attachments ,facility details and transaction accounts. amount of the new LC.
Copy From LC
Create a Import Letter of Credit initiation from an existing Import Letter of Credit.
Upload LC
Create a Letter of Credit initiation by uploading a file.
Back To Back LC
Create a Letter of Credit initiation from an Import Letter of Credit that you are the beneficiary of.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Import Letter of Credit records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Import Letter of Credit records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: From Scratch Form - Licenses
section.para: Click on the Link License button and the List of Licenses appears. Use System ID and License Number fields to narrow down your search.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Beneficiary Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the expiry date for the LC from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the expiry date is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the LC Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the LC Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the transaction amount of the LC (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the transaction amount of the LC, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

If you have already linked a license, the details are displayed for System ID, Back Office Reference, License Number and Allocated Amount. You can choose to delete a linked license by clicking the Delete
icon in the right-hand column.

To create a template, either enter the known details into a scratch form, or user the "Copy from LC" option to create a new one, and remove the fields that are likely to change each time the template is used.

section.title: LC Initiation - Back to back LC
section.para: A Back-to-Back Credit is also known as a Counter Credit. It is often used as a method of finance to enable an export agent to buy goods from a supplier or manufacturer and sell them to a final buyer with a settlement effected by documentary credits.

In practice, the Back-to-Back LC can be described as an Import Letter of Credit initiated by the applicant from the details of an Export Letter of Credit for which the applicant is designated as the beneficiary.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of your existing (non-purged) Export Commercial and Received Standby LCs.

section.title: LC Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Message to Bank - Claim Processing
section.para: This option allows you to communicate with the bank for requesting a settlement for the LC and to process the claim.

When selected, this option presents a list of Message to Bank records that requires customers to present a request for settlement of the LC. The records displayed here follows a process where you have to initiate (to initiate a LC, refer to the topic LC Initiation) and submit a LC to the Bank, and the Bank approves your LC in the back-office from Pending Records. The record then moves to the Existing Records section in the back-office. The Bank now sets the reporting status to Claim Presentation and the LC is updated in the system, at your end, in the Message to Bank - Claim Processing section. You are expected to enter the claim details for the LC on this screen and submit it to the Bank for further processing.

Click on the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System ID, Entity, Bank Ref., Claim Reference, Beneficiary Name or Claim Currency fields. The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: Message to Bank - Retrieve Unsigned

Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: LC Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Import Letters of Credit records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: LC Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all LC transactions and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now associate an entity for the LC by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: LC Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a LC record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: LC Maintenance - Unsigned LCs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Import Letters of Credit transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: LC Maintenance - Purged LCs
section.para: List and optionally delete Import Letters of Credit transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: LC Maintenance - Rejected LCs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Import Letters of Credit records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
